Ingredients.8: 2 (3.5 ounce) packages dark chocolate, finely chopped

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet or line with parchment paper.

Directions.2: Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until foamy. Continue beating until stiff peaks form.

Directions.3: Combine marzipan with 1/2 of the confectioners' sugar and rub with your fingers until mixture resembles bread crumbs. Add coconut, remaining confectioners' sugar, lemon zest, and rum. Mix well. Fold in stiff egg whites.

Directions.4: Using 2 teaspoons, drop small dollops of mixture onto the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with sugar.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until the macaroons are golden but soft to the touch, about 20 minutes. Transfer to a cooling rack and cool completely, 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Directions.6: Place 3/4 of the chocolate in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in remaining chocolate until melted.

Directions.7: Dip 1/3 of each cooled macaroon into the melted chocolate. Set macaroons on waxed paper until chocolate has set. Store the macaroons in an airtight container, with waxed paper between the layers.
